University Policy

We aspire to open research culture that values a diverse range of contributions and adheres to the FAIR principles to enable the results of our research to be of maximum benefit to society (findable, accessible, interoperable and reusable), whilst also respecting circumstances that limit data sharing (for example, due to issues of privacy, non-consent, contractual agreements, legislation or practicality). - University statement on Open Research


University policy on Open Research aspires to an open research culture that adheres to the FAIR principles.

title: ORDA for FAIR4RS
text:
Copy & Edit ORDA.yaml
name: Release to ORDA
on:
  workflow_dispatch:
  release:
    types: [published]
jobs:
  upload:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    env:
      ARCHIVE_NAME: ${{ github.event.repository.name }}-${{ github.event.release.tag_name }}
    steps:
      - name: prepare-data-folder
        run : mkdir 'data'
      - name: download-archive
        run: |
          curl -sL "${{ github.event.release.zipball_url }}" > "$ARCHIVE_NAME".zip
          curl -sL "${{ github.event.release.tarball_url }}" > "$ARCHIVE_NAME".tar.gz
      - name: move-archive
        run: |
          mv "$ARCHIVE_NAME".zip data/
          mv "$ARCHIVE_NAME".tar.gz data/
      - name: upload-to-figshare
        uses: figshare/github-upload-action@v1.1
        with:
          FIGSHARE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.FIGSHARE_TOKEN }}
          FIGSHARE_ENDPOINT: 'https://api.figshare.com/v2'
          FIGSHARE_ARTICLE_ID: 123456789  # Change this number!
          DATA_DIR: 'data'

This is easy, make a copy of the ORDA.yaml from the repository and save it in your repositories .github/workflows/ORDA.yaml. Edit the value of FIGSHARE_ARTICLE_ID

text:
Add badge to README.md
[![ORDA](https://img.shields.io/badge/ORDA--DOI-10.123456%2Fshef.data.123456789.v.1-lightgrey)](https://figshare.shef.ac.uk/articles/software/TopoStats/123456789/1)

You can add a badge to you repositories README.md which makes it easier for people to find and cite your work, one of the key ideas behind the FAIR principles. The URL for the badge will depend on your DOI and the link will depend on the URL of your package on ORDA.
Once done stage and commit all changes, this will be the README.md you‚Äôve just modified and adding the .github/workflows/ORDA.yaml. Push these to GitHub.

GitHub Releases





The process of making a release is unchanged, go to the repository and then navigate to releases/new, choose a tag and create if required. Add a title and you can get a summary of changes by auto-generating the release notes which pulls in the title of commits (only really useful if you‚Äôve clear and effective PR headings). Set as a pre-release if required and then Publish.
